title: Scroll of change material

| ? [![Scroll.png](/images/8/8d/Scroll.png)](/wiki/File:Scroll.png) |                                                               |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                              | change material                                               |
| Appearance                                                        | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |
| Base price                                                        | 200 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                             |
| Weight                                                            | 5                                                             |
| Ink to write                                                      | [8-15](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker")                     |
| Monster use                                                       | *Will not be used by monsters.*                               |

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), the **scroll of change material** can warp the [material](/wiki/Material "Material") of an item.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Effects](#Effects)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)
- [4 Messages](#Messages)
- [5 Origin](#Origin)
- [6 References](#References)

## Effects

When read, the scroll will affect a single item in your inventory. There is a 1⁄2 chance of your [wielded](/wiki/Wield "Wield") item being targeted, if there is one. Otherwise a random piece of worn [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor") will be targeted.

If no item was targeted, you will abuse your strength and constitution if the scroll was [cursed](/wiki/Cursed "Cursed"); you will [exercise](/wiki/Exercise "Exercise") those stats if the scroll was not cursed.

If an item was targeted, its material will be changed. If the scroll is cursed, the resulting material will be plastic if possible; additionally the item will be cursed and lose its [erodeproofing](/wiki/Erodeproof "Erodeproof"). If the scroll is [blessed](/wiki/Blessed "Blessed"), the item will be blessed.

If you read the scroll while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused"), the effects are the same as when reading a cursed scroll.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Object materials (SpliceHack)](/wiki/Object_materials_\(SpliceHack\) "Object materials (SpliceHack)")*

Sometimes changing an object material is useful. In SpliceHack an armor's material can affect its [AC](/wiki/AC "AC"), and there are damage bonuses for using weapons made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"), [copper](/wiki/Copper "Copper") and [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver"). Some materials such as [mithril](/wiki/Mithril "Mithril") are also immune to [erosion](/wiki/Erosion "Erosion").

Reading cursed scrolls of change material (or scrolls of any beatitude while confused) should be avoided unless you intentionally want [plastic](/wiki/Plastic "Plastic") armor or weapons. For armor normally made of [cloth](/wiki/Cloth "Cloth") or [leather](/wiki/Leather "Leather"), plastic is not bad by comparison. However for armor normally made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron") or [metal](/wiki/Metal "Metal"), plastic offers relatively poor [AC](/wiki/AC "AC"). Plastic weapons suffer a -2 damage penalty.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

Like most scrolls, scrolls of change material are single-use. If there are a high number of items to warp or the goal is to obtain a specific material, many scrolls may be required. In these cases, it may be desirable to use a [transmuter](/wiki/Transmuter_\(SpliceHack\) "Transmuter (SpliceHack)") to change materials instead.

## Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), the scroll of change material was renamed to the *scroll of transmogrify*. There are a few minor differences: If the identify of this scroll is already known, you will instead be prompted for the specific item to target. [Artifacts](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") are no longer valid targets. The resulting material can also be one that the hero [hate](/index.php?title=Hate\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Hate (page does not exist)").

The [dragonhide](/wiki/Dragonhide "Dragonhide") material is also implemented and works the same as in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), so this can be a fantastic goal for turning ordinary cloaks, helms, and gloves into more powerful armor.

## Messages

- Your skin crawls for a moment.

  You read a scroll of change material and no item was targeted.

- You have a strange feeling for a moment, then it passes.

  As above, but you were a [beginner](/wiki/Beginner "Beginner").

- \<item> glows with a strange yellow light!

  You read a scroll of change material and an item was targeted.

- \<item> glows with a sickly green light!

  As above, but the scroll was cursed or you were confused.

## Origin

The scroll of change material originates from the roguelike [IVAN](https://attnam.com/wiki/Scroll_of_Change_Material), where it has a similar function. In IVAN, item material is the primary determinant of item quality, making this scroll incredibly valuable. It can even be used to alter the player's limbs: so-called prosthetics can give the player strength and speed far beyond what is attainable through "normal" growth, but as they do not heal naturally, the necessity to repair them with more scrolls of change material or scrolls of repair can complicate matters.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) <https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/src/read.c#L1937>
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) <https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/src/weapon.c#L531-L534>
